issue.title: NCCs cause strange MPI crashes after commit 4232435 in 3D domains with distributed processor meshes

content.raw:
Interesting! Let me know what you find, and if you can fix the NCC caching problem. Might be manifesting in the originally reported bug for some reason.  
  
The more I work with this bug, the more I’m feeling like it’s not actually a problem with MPI, but has something to do with something else going subtly wrong…maybe this is it. If it were an MPI problem, then it should fail at 1150 as well \(the MPI calls don’t change\).
